comments.comment: Are you using the very latest code? Can you guy pull and try again?

Are you using the very latest code? Can you guy pull and try again?
!ok, the latest code is great,thank!

I pulled the latest update and I still get this error RuntimeError: cannot perform reduction function max on tensor with no elements because the operation does not have an identity I am running a single class weights and cfg

I pulled the latest update and I still get this error RuntimeError: cannot perform reduction function max on tensor with no elements because the operation does not have an identity I am running a single class weights and cfg
1.check your labels/txt,are there some empty txt? 2.I change .cfg test-batch=2,subvision=1,i do not which step makes me success,you can try.
in my deviceÔºånms will cost 0.01s (per image)Ôºåwhich is almost the model(tiny) cost!!!Is your newest code optimize this?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/PointCloudNiphon>@PointCloudNiphon</denchmark-link> this repo probably has the fastest NMS available in the world. Inference on COCO with yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt at 608 img-size uses only 1.6 ms for NMS per image. See <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues/679#issuecomment-594768733>#679 (comment)</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarcoRizk>@MarcoRizk</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ggyybb>@ggyybb</denchmark-link> can you supply viable code to reproduce?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarcoRizk>@MarcoRizk</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ggyybb>@ggyybb</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/commit/b8b89a31329da9ba4146493e73f4762abca741e4>b8b89a3</denchmark-link> may fix this issue. Please and try again.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/PointCloudNiphon>@PointCloudNiphon</denchmark-link> BTW you can use the argument in test.py to see the timing breakdown between inference and NMS also. Hmm I suppose I should add this to detect.py as well. <denchmark-code>python3 test.py --weights ... --cfg ... --data ... --profile </denchmark-code>
Inference can be sped up with larger batch sizes, but NMS is run per image in all cases, so the only ways to affect it's speed currently are here. Note that the 1.6 ms profile time uses all default settings though (none of these speedups are applied).
Increase your conf_thres Turn off multi_cls Decrease iou_thres
yolov3/utils/utils.py
Line 504 in 1dc1761
def non_max_suppression(prediction, conf_thres=0.1, iou_thres=0.6, multi_cls=True, classes=None, agnostic=False):
This issue is stale because it has been open 30 days with no activity. Remove Stale label or comment or this will be closed in 5 days.
